info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 1:54PM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Berkeley County in southeastern South Carolina... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread heavy rain in association with Hurricane Ian. A tropical rain band will continue to move across the Highway 17 corridor from Mount Pleasant to McCellanville this afternoon which will produce heavy rain. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Highway 17 may see overflowing ditches, leading to area of significant water on the road surface from Awendaw to McClellanville. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Daniel Island, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Price Inlet, Capers Inlet, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Wando, Cainhoy, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Hampton Plantation State Park, Boone Hall Plantation, Cape Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre and Santee Coastal Reserve. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
